item.title: Broccoli, Cauliflower, Carrots
item.description: Broccoli, Cauliflower, Carrots for Zero Minutes Came out tender, but not mushy. Quick released after 1 minute. * Photo

item.title: Chicken Breasts
item.description: Chicken breasts at 158 for 2 hours Recently cooked refrigerated chicken breasts at 158 degrees for 2 hours. It came out fantastically moist and delicious. Definitely one of the first major wins in my early sous vide journey. * Article * Photo

item.title: Eggs
item.description: Eggs at 167 for 13 minutes Did the 167 degree for 13 minutes recipe. The egg came out still having white as runny on the outside, which made it easy to break and get out. * Article

item.title: Ribs
item.description: Ribs 3-2-1 Method Came out tender, but not fall off the bone. Basically, followed various sites and books; there isn’t a lot to the basic process. Removed the membrane and used a rib rub. Place ribs in smoker at 225 degrees F for three hours. Wrap ribs tightly in foil and smoke for 2 hours. Take foil off and return to smoker bone side down for 1 hour. Apply sauce to ribs during the last 30 minutes of cooking time.

item.title: Sous Vide Item: Cast Iron
item.description: Cast Iron For Searing Bought two cast iron skillets to sear. These both are made by Lodge and heavy. I seasoned them three times at 400 degrees for an hour each time. * Photo

item.title: Sous Vide Item: ChefSteps Joule Cooker
item.description: Joule Cooker This in the only one I’ve ever owned, so I can’t commet on others. So far, so good though. Performance 1100 watts heating power Temperature accuracy 0.2 째F / 0.1 째C Maximum water temperature 208 째F (98 째C) Maximum bath volume 10+ gallons Article

item.title: Sous Vide Item: Ping Pong Balls?
item.description: Ping Pong Balls To Retain Heat Went to the Dollar Tree near my house and bought 8 packages of 6 balls. These trap the water from evaporating on long cooks. It has so far been extremely effective. * Photo

item.title: Tri-Tip
item.description: Morton’s Tri-tip at 130 for 6 hours Came out extremely tender. 7 hours might make it a little better in the middle. Cutting a 3.5 - 4 lb tri-tip in half also could help. Seared in a cast iron skillet with oil and butter. 15 seconds per flip for two minutes. * Photo

item.title: FAQ
item.description: Not a huge deal for this with the Internets. 1. WHAT IF I HAVE ADDITIONAL QUESTIONS? Google. Then Google. Next Google. Finally Google. In case you haven’t found the answer for your question please feel free to give up :)
